abstracts.cdata!:
In order to improve the productivity of
            Finnish forests the Government has introduced a Forest
            Improvement Program (MERA III). The project forms part of
            this program and includes forest improvement works to
            increase wood growth in some 60,000 farmer-owned and 26
            company-owned forests in South Finland and the most
            southerly part of North Finland. The operations comprise:
            (a) seeding and planting some 136,000 ha; (b) seedling stand
            improvement of some 315,000 ha; (c) application of
            fertilizers on some 710,000 ha; (d) drainage of some 550,000
            ha; and (e) construction of about 8,400 km of access and
            extraction roads.
